metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5036 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.98 for Mac, Windows, and Linux and 57.0.2987.108 for Android allowed a remote attacker to have an unspecified impact via a crafted PDF file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5036` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276').
